name: The St. Regis Shenzhen

reviews.text: The St Regis in Shenzhen is the tallest building in town, the view is incomparable, the architecture breath-taking, the interior décor worthy of design awards; but there my superlatives end for this hotel.
reviews.title: Stunning building and design but very poor restaurants and servers

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days of business and found the atmosphere to be cold and clinical, mostly efficient but soul-less, with a good deal of over-pricing on food and drinks into the bargain.
reviews.title: lovely afternoon tea!

reviews.text: It started well for us, as when you enter the lobby on the 96th floor, it is a very impressive sight and this large area makes an excellent space for meetings etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, just shortly short of being perfect

reviews.text: However, there is generally a rather dark theme about the style of this hotel, which even extends to the rooms. I cannot say that anything was lacking in facilities or comfort of the rooms, but there was sometimes a feeling of being on the set of a Sci-Fi film when walking about the place.
reviews.title: Fascinating, but not perfect......

reviews.text: Turning to the food, this we found disappointing, as rather surprisingly, we also found the service in the restaurants. Social was the best of the restaurants and the least expensive. Here the huge breakfast buffet has something to please most tastes. Later in the day there were some tasty dishes, such as Thai Curry and good Caesar salads. However, the quality of the service was poor. There were very few servers who understood English well enough to take an order for anything that varied from the standard. It also proved just about impossible to get three people to have food all served at the same time.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Shenzhen hands dow

reviews.text: Image if you bought a brand new Macbook Pro, and it ran the original 1984 MAC OS Desktop.
reviews.title: Great Hardware, Software Needs Update

reviews.text: Pun intended. It's a state of the art hotel with a great view from the 95th floor lobby. There's an ipad to control all of the electronics in the room and it’s ergonomically fit. PRESS Spa on the room supplied Ipad and the widow from your room to the bathroom mists, mood lighting and music ensues. They are still working on their service and try very hard. This hotel is of course in China - to expect the norm. Don't forget to add the daily breakfast buffet onto your bill. You should be able to negotiate this add for about $20 / day. As in all hotels in china, you can ask for more for less and they might. It's still worth $30 as it will get your day started right (before everything outside of the hotel will be cooked in pig fat)! Recommend; especially for those on Business and need a western home in this Chinese business hub.
reviews.title: On top of the clouds, literally

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Selecting the St. Regis for my stay in Shenzhen came at the recommendation of a close colleague. You have no problem locating this establishment, as it is the tallest building in town, the thirds tallest hotel in China, and the eighth highest hotel in the world. The building is 441 meters tall. I must confess, part of my anticipation of staying at this hotel was pure adventure, I wanted the experience. Not that I am a particular enthusiast of tall buildings, having my own home in Finland firmly at ground level. With this on my mind, arrival by taxi from the Shenzhen airport was smooth as silk. I was greeted and shown to the lift which brought me to the hotel lobby on the 95th floor in a little over 14 seconds. The lobby can take your breath away, it is so well designed, as if the view and the interior are one. Check in was equally efficient, with a smile, and then by way of a second series of lifts I was shown to my room on the 82nd floor. Again, the room and its view was superb. I was greeted with an automated welcome, complementing the kind service of the hotel butler who accompanied me there from the reception. Both butler and room service were highly efficient.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: A word about the room itself, which is impecably designed and well kept. This is a high-tech hotel, everything in the room can be operated by the inhouse iPad provided. The lighting, tv, dvd (a wide selection of films), sound, cooling and heating depending on your preference, communication with staff, and among others, day, night and room curtain functions are easily operated. Just opening the curtains provides the breathtaking experience of the most spectacular view of the city and horizon beyond.This technology works.
reviews.title: Bryan So
Luxury and comfort stay
reviews.text: The meeting room facilities located on the fith floor were functional, coffee and tea service of good quality. Any technical requests were seen to forthwith by people who knew what they were doing. The patio area adjoining the meeting room was a good plus for intermissions during the meeting we attended.
Staff was fantastic the service was outstanding. Some staff member's English was not great but incredibly helpful and everything I needed during this business.
reviews.title: Highest hotel in Shenzhen

reviews.text: Room is very clean and front desk staff was fantastic. Great lounge area as well.
reviews.title: Uniquely excellent experience

reviews.text: Had a two day biz trip to Shenzhen recently and was lucky to get put up in the St Regis which is the one at the top of the mega tall tower. I've stayed at Park Hyatt Shanghai and tbh I'm not a huge fan of the high hotels. St Regis had more of a welcoming, funky vibe than PH Shanghai. The design/decor of this hotel is absolutely stunning. I remember walking into the restaurant and seeing those astounding white scultpure chairs with the big faces on the back. Unexpected! Fun! Usually I associated St regis is low key elegance, this one really blew me away with the design. And of course the views. You command the entire city and much of the New territories (exaggerating a bit). If you want to feel like the commander on high, this is the place. Plus it's close to a big new shopping center--KK which has reasonably priced restaurants and a grocery store in it--extremely convenient.
reviews.title: Cloud living
It is just so so
reviews.text: They service overall was as good as you expect at a St Regis. Everyone remembers your name and goes out of their way to make everything perfect. And they'll back off if you signal that you're not in the mood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a couple small flaws--one to do with the free pressing service. I was told on check in that I would get three pieces pressed free. The next day I asked to take them up on it, but they told me that it was only valid the first day you arrive. The others involved them gym. The water in showers was not hot and the steam rooms were not turned on.
reviews.title: Amaizing

reviews.text: The obvious differentiator of this property is the building - with a lobby on the 96th floor, and rooms from 75 up (mine was on the 87th floor), it just stands out from every other hotel. Now on to the details.
reviews.title: Overall pretty good

reviews.text: I had asked for a pick up at HKG airport, the driver was there, but the car was pretty beat up. Not what I expected after paying 2000RMB. However, the driver was friendly, got me to the hotel as quickly as possible. The check in process was ok, and the room simply outstanding. The views were awesome, and everything worked well. The location is also very good. On the whole, an excellent property.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: The only issue in this hotel is the lack of English speaking skills. This caused my room service order to be messed up, but the recovery was quick and seamless. On the whole, I was very pleased with the stay, and would definitely go back again. Compared to the absolute disaster that is the St. Regis Singapore, this hotel is way superior.
reviews.title: OK if relax! The best in Shenzhen I beg though

reviews.text: Amazing hotel and a breathtaking view. A fine upmarket hotel and great customer service. One of the finest chains that keep upgrading itself to meet the demands of the changing world.
reviews.title: Nice view from 97th floor but...

reviews.text: The room sizes are by good and gives a great feel and experience of luxury at it best.
reviews.title: Perfect stay at the highest hotel in china

description: The St Regis Shenzhen occupies the 73rd to the 100th floor of Shenzhen’s tallest building and commands only the most impressive views from each of it’s elegant guest rooms and seductive facilities. Located in the heart of the Luohu district in the successful Special Economic Zone, opposite the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, this exclusive urban hotel is the tallest St Regis in the world. With 297 beautifully appointed guest rooms, 2100 sqm of luxurious meeting space, the choice of 7 exquisite restaurants and bars plus a state of the art exercise room, 28m lap pool and the Iridium Spa, staying at the St Regis Shenzhen is an experience beyond expectation.
